numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy students have a greater overall chance of admission to elite schools than non-legacy students.
2. After the 50th percentile of parents' income rank, the chance of admission for legacy students increases.
3. After the 50th percentile of parents' income rank, the chance of admission for non-legacy students decreases.
4. For non-legacy students, the chance of admission decreases when the family is richer.
5. For non-legacy students, the chance of admission goes below average before the 90th percentile of parents' income rank.
6. After the 90th percentile of parents' income rank, the chance of admission for non-legacy students increases again.
7. I ask why legacy status is valued more.
8. I ask why the chance of admission decreases so much for non-legacy students between the 70th percentile and the 90th percentile of parents' income rank.
9. I ask how many students in these schools have legacy status.
11. If a student does not have legacy status then the student has fewer chances of admission.
13. Applying to elite schools is very competitive.
14. For a non-legacy student, legacy preference is a great disadvantage.
15. Non-legacy students do hard work to get the same grades as legacy students.
16. Non-legacy students have a lower chance of admission than legacy students.
17. Legacy students have an advantage in admission decisions.
18. The headline is: The College Admission Game: Perks of Being Legacy Status.
